intro: Jussiaea stenorraphe var. macrosepala, commonly known as the broad-sepal jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as forest understories and wetlands.
